page.title: 16TOURISM
page.content: Bath naturally attracts thousands of tourists from all over the world throughout the year. It would be fair to say that Bath depends on tourism for prosperity. The wide variety of shops back this up together with the museums, cafes, retaurants, cinemas and places of historic interest which all cater for the needs of the tourist. Away from the city centre the number of hotels and restaurants increases, encouraged by lower rates but still with good acess. Away from the river flood plain the land slopes up towards the south and the land use is predominantly residential. Traffic is a major problem for this GEORGIAN city in the C20th _ there are too many cars,lorries and coaches and too few places to put them. At Christmas a park and ride scheme is operated but the problem is there all year.
